metadata.name: Potential SysInternals ProcDump Evasion
metadata.comment: Detects uses of the SysInternals ProcDump utility in which ProcDump or its output get renamed, or a dump file is moved or copied to a different name

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('copy procdump')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('move procdump')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('copy ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.dmp ')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('2.dmp')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('lsass')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('out.dmp'))) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('copy lsass.exe_')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('move lsass.exe_'))))

output.summary: Detects uses of the SysInternals ProcDump utility in which ProcDump or its output get renamed, or a dump file is moved or copied to a different name

metadata.objective: False positive: False positives are expected in cases in which ProcDump just gets copied to a different directory without any renaming Reference: https://twitter.com/mrd0x/status/1480785527901204481
